headline.main: Guatemala's Next Leader Eyes GPS Tags on Teachers, Phones for Kids
headline.print_headline: Guatemala's Next Leader Eyes GPS Tags on Teachers, Phones for Kids

docs.snippet: Basking in the glory of a landslide in Guatemala's presidential election, a former comedian with no government experience has some unorthodox policy plans: he will tag teachers with GPS trackers to ensure attendance and give poor kids smartphones....
docs.lead_paragraph: Basking in the glory of a landslide in Guatemala's presidential election, a former comedian with no government experience has some unorthodox policy plans: he will tag teachers with GPS trackers to ensure attendance and give poor kids smartphones.

headline.main: AAC Favorite SMU Coping With Coach's Suspension, Tourney Ban
headline.print_headline: AAC Favorite SMU Coping With Coach's Suspension, Tourney Ban

docs.snippet: Larry Brown's five decades in coaching have been marked by considerable highs and mostly flattering words....
docs.lead_paragraph: Larry Brown's five decades in coaching have been marked by considerable highs and mostly flattering words.

headline.main: Fatally Scalded Inmate Was Kept in Cell With Broken Heater
headline.print_headline: Fatally Scalded Inmate Was Kept in Cell With Broken Heater

docs.snippet: A convicted murderer under observation for behavioral problems was allowed to remain in his cell as he destroyed a radiator over an 8-hour period, eventually flooding the tier with water and scalding himself to death, according to an internal inve...
docs.lead_paragraph: A convicted murderer under observation for behavioral problems was allowed to remain in his cell as he destroyed a radiator over an 8-hour period, eventually flooding the tier with water and scalding himself to death, according to an internal investigative report obtained Tuesday by The Associated Press.

headline.main: House Votes to Revive Trade Lender, but Senate Path Unclear
headline.print_headline: House Votes to Revive Trade Lender, but Senate Path Unclear

docs.snippet: The U.S. House of Representatives voted overwhelmingly to renew the Export-Import Bank's charter on Tuesday, but the path for the trade lender's ultimate revival remained unclear in the Senate, where Majority Leader Mitch McConnell opposes it....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. House of Representatives voted overwhelmingly to renew the Export-Import Bank's charter on Tuesday, but the path for the trade lender's ultimate revival remained unclear in the Senate, where Majority Leader Mitch McConnell opposes it.

headline.main: DC Police Investigating Rough Arrest Caught on Video
headline.print_headline: DC Police Investigating Rough Arrest Caught on Video

headline.main: 2 Detroit Cops Accused of Stealing From People They Stopped
headline.print_headline: 2 Detroit Cops Accused of Stealing From People They Stopped

docs.snippet: Two members of an elite Detroit police unit are accused of stealing money from people they stopped on the street and with fabricating information about an arrest....

headline.main: Bush Proposes Overhaul of Social Security, Medicare
headline.print_headline: Bush Proposes Overhaul of Social Security, Medicare

docs.snippet: Republican presidential candidate Jeb Bush is proposing significant changes to Social Security and Medicare to keep the costly federal entitlement programs on solid financial footing....
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican presidential candidate Jeb Bush is proposing significant changes to Social Security and Medicare to keep the costly federal entitlement programs on solid financial footing.

headline.main: Life Insurers Admit to Offering 'Kickbacks': Senator Warren
headline.print_headline: Life Insurers Admit to Offering 'Kickbacks': Senator Warren

docs.snippet: Senator Elizabeth Warren said 13 major U.S. life insurers had admitted to using incentives such as expensive vacations and gifts, which could encourage agents "to put their own interests ahead of their clients."...
docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Elizabeth Warren said 13 major U.S. life insurers had admitted to using incentives such as expensive vacations and gifts, which could encourage agents "to put their own interests ahead of their clients."

headline.main: IBM Says It Faces Probe of Accounting Practices
headline.print_headline: IBM Says It Faces Probe of Accounting Practices

docs.snippet: IBM said Tuesday that federal regulators are investigating its accounting of some of its business transactions in the United States, the United Kingdom and Ireland....
docs.lead_paragraph: IBM said Tuesday that federal regulators are investigating its accounting of some of its business transactions in the United States, the United Kingdom and Ireland.
